#Text=Canada 's Don Valley West ( Ward 25 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Friday , November 3 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontonians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Don Valley West ( Ward 25 ) .
#Text=Three candidates responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include John Blair , Robertson Boyle , Tony Dickins , Cliff Jenkins ( incumbent ) , and Peter Kapsalis .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=John Blair
#Text=48-year-old
#Text=John Blair is a high school English teacher .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A : First , I propose a personal property tax freeze .
#Text=After three consecutive years of increases above the inflation rate , homeowners need some breathing space .
#Text=Many are in danger of losing their homes due to higher taxes ( just as tenants are being evicted from their apartments because of rising rents at a record levels in Toronto ) .
#Text=We need to apply the brakes .
#Text=Second , developers , who ( inspired by nothing other than optimum profit ) ignore the wishes of communities in all wards , need to be taken to task .
#Text=Public appeals to the Ontario Municipal Board ( OMB ) are almost never successful while appeals by developers are disproportionately successful .
#Text=Nothing short of dismantling the OMB will start to solve this situation .
#Text=Third , the Toronto Council pay raise is inexcusable and I will invest my 8.9 % raise in worthwhile Ward 25 causes .
#Text=Elected officials need to earn the respect of the electorate by showing leadership in their own finances .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A : Definitely , over-development and intensification .
#Text=Real two-way communication is necessary between neighbourhoods and the developers who propose to transform a given area .
#Text=Ward 25 residents like their living spaces and any new development has to " make sense " to the people currently living in the proximity , not just dollars for developers .
#Text=There must be a vision -- a " fitting in " with the existing character of a community .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A : For some time , I have thought about being more involved in the challenges that face Toronto .
#Text=I want to live to a higher standard than just to live for myself .
#Text=Public service is an honourable calling .

#Text=With the demolition of the former Don Mills Centre indoor mall ( to be replaced by an outdoor lifestyle centre ( courtesy of the Ontario Teachers ' Pension Plan and its instrument , Cadillac Fairview ) , I finally made my decision .

#Text=The Don Mills Centre was already more than a shopping mall -- it was a friendly village for old and young alike , and now it has been levelled to satisfy the greed of a ruthless developer and its owner .
